we would like to know if this approach to bumper design would be legal?
we were thinking of using the bumper shape as a way to center the cage, where the height of the bumper varies in order to do this.

This is sort of an annoying response, but if it doesn’t break any of the bumper rules then it’s legal.

That being said, as long as your bumpers fill the bumper zone and meet the construction requirement then I don’t see any reason you couldn’t make them a convenient shape for functionality. Make sure the padding is fully supported by the backer! Or, alternately, there’s nothing saying the backer alone can’t have this shape.

I wouldn’t call it an annoying response, but the correct response. If there’s no rule against it then it’s legal.

As some prior work, 1706 had some shape to their bumpers last year.

While the rules have changed this year, looking at how they changed and comparing last year’s design could give you a hint as to where to be looking for rules that potentially invalidate your design

While the answers you’ve gotten so far are pretty much on target, I will add one note of caution. The design you have in your sketch has unsupported corners at the outside top. You might have trouble with the robot inspectors over that, because they might not consider it safe since it could break off under impact. I know at least one team’s bumpers last year got dinged because they just elevated the front support board vs the other support boards (i.e., they didn’t have a bend or other smooth transition.) Whether that will happen this year or not will probably depend both on formal rules interpretation and on what the inspectors at your events decide. I’d suggest adding some wood on the sides to make a smooth line from side to front support boards. That way, you know you’re covered (in every sense.)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-01-10T15:27:14.160Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":309,"readers_count":308,"score":91.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":480684,"topic_slug":"bumper-legality-question","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-legality-question/480684/6","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3478012,"name":"Eric Bergquist","username":"kitare102","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kitare102/{size}/212327_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-10T16:11:14.555Z","cooked":"

FYI, you have it backwards. All padding needs to have a backer, but not all of the backer needs to be padded. See the diagram from R402:

I believe this means that you could create some pretty insane functional plywood shapes above the padding that also happen to be integral with the backer for the padding. It also may be beneficial to extend you backer upwards to act as a barrier for deep cages to bounce off of while going through the barge zone, rather than having your guards mounted on the robot.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-01-10T16:14:25.953Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":119.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":480684,"topic_slug":"bumper-legality-question","display_username":"Eric Bergquist","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64712,"username":"OKolodner","name":"Oliver Kolodner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/okolodner/{size}/242861_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23148,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach Eric, FRC 3100 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-legality-question/480684/7","custom_user_title":"Coach Eric, FRC 3100 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3478072,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-10T16:52:22.133Z","cooked":"
Strategic:

The design you have in your sketch has unsupported corners at the outside top. You might have trouble with the robot inspectors over that, because they might not consider it safe since it could break off under impact.

(my answer as of Team Update 01)

Legal: There is no rule that bumper (or “bumper backing”) must back up to the robot frame/ be well supported.

Could RI’s/LRI’s consider this design unsafe? Yes they could.

Figure 8-5 shows a bumper up against the “robot perimeter”, and everything is measured from the “robot perimeter”.

But that’s it - no “gap” measurement or requirement.
If you want 1" of air between robot frame and bumpers, it’s legal (as long as you meet the very few bumper requirements listed).

That being said - PLEASE, for the love of all that is holy and the sanity of the RI’s - Back Up Your Bumpers to the Robot Frame/ “robot perimeter”.

Historically, having a bumper “well supported” worked. That’s why the rules were persnickety - they were trying to save you from yourself.

Having support gaps caused bumpers backing to crack, bend, and even completely break through the plywood (ask me how I know) - and worse.

This year - it’s the wild west.
The new rules allow you to have a poor design, and if it gets obliterated… that’s on you.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-01-10T17:09:53.069Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":64.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":480684,"topic_slug":"bumper-legality-question","display_username":"Robertson Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32239,"username":"SurfGear","name":"Christine Low","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24506,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/bumper-legality-question/480684/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3478142,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-10T17:46:47.388Z","cooked":"

Clearly no under previous year’s rules. But we are not using previous year’s rules are we? Under current rules as written probably so, providing you meet the other bumper rules. but I don’t think the GDC intended non-rectangular bumpers. The is a question best asked to Q&A. They are the only ones that can give a definitive answer. It might take several tries to get an answer you can use. It is likely to get the attention of the LRI because it is different as well as the bumper rules are different.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-01-10T17:56:17.141Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":480684,"topic_slug":"bumper-legality-question","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-legality-question/480684/10","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3484761,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T17:56:46.564Z","cooked":"
gerthworm:

As some prior work,

Strategic:

I know at least one team’s bumpers last year

s3529:

a figure from last year

Rules underwent a major rewrite this year, forget what the rules were last year, forget what some inspector told you years ago, forget what your gut feeling is. If there is no rule against it then its legal, if you are unsure of how to interpret a rule go to the Q&A, but in this case no one has come up with a specific rule that might be interpreted as disallowing this shape.

Having poorly supported bumpers is definitely legal this year. Having weirdly shaped bumpers is legal this year as long as you aren’t wedging and are meeting the padding thickness requirements.

My image is an example of applying the 2025 rules to a picture from 2024. It’s not intended to apply any of the 2024 rules to the current year. I suppose I could have drawn a new figure from scratch to show the same point.

Legal, but you better know what you’re doing.

At what point does a bumper “notch” like the OP sketched become a bumper “gap”, which is limited to 1.25" per R401? Is it OK as long as some amount of bumper is continuous under the notch?
